p: Both 25OHC and 27OHC are side-chain oxysterols physiologically present in human peripheral blood, cerebrospinal fluid [ 14, 15], colostrum and milk [ 16]. 27OHC is constitutively the most abundant oxysterol in these biological fluids and present in various tissues and organs, being synthesized by the ubiquitous mitochondrial enzyme 27-cholesterol hydroxylase (Cyp27A1) [ 15].
